intro: Dilodendron, commonly known as the broad-leafed evergreen, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. Dilodendron species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in wet or swampy habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems where it is native.
